node.title: SWAT Responds to a Synagogue in Dallas-Fort Worth Area
node.alt: Heavily armed officers responded to Congregation Beth Israel Synagogue in Colleyville, Texas,Â on Saturday.
node.description: A man could be heard shouting on a livestream from Congregation Beth Israel in Colleyville, Texas.
node.content: ["Heavily armed police officers were responding on Saturday to a synagogue in the Dallas-Fort Worth area, where a man could be heard shouting on the congregation\u2019s livestream.", "The police were responding to Congregation Beth Israel, a Reform Jewish synagogue in Colleyville, Texas, a city of about 26,000 residents that is about 15 miles northeast of Fort Worth.", "\u201cWe are currently conducting SWAT operations around the 6100 block of Pleasant Run Rd,\u201d the Colleyville Police Department said on Twitter at about 12:30 p.m. local time. \u201cAll residents in the immediate area are being evacuated. Please avoid the area.\u201d", "About 90 minutes later, the police said the \u201csituation\u201d remained \u201congoing.\u201d", "\u201cWe ask that you continue to avoid the area,\u201d the police said.", "The congregation had been scheduled to hold a Saturday morning Sabbath service, which was being livestreamed on its Facebook page.", "On the livestream, a man could be heard shouting about dying and not liking police officers, although the context was not clear because the stream was inaudible at times. A video of the livestream did not show what was going on inside the synagogue.", "The man could also be heard asking to get his sister on the phone before the livestream stopped.", "\u201cIt\u2019s a deal,\u201d he said at one point. \u201cIt\u2019s a deal I had with you.\u201d", "Congregation Beth Israel is led by Rabbi Charlie Cytron-Walker, according to its website.", "\u201cPlease join me in prayer for the safety of Rabbi Charlie and all the congregants at Congregation Beth Israel in Colleyville,\u201d Craig Goldman, a Texas state representative, said on Twitter.", "U.S. Representative Colin Allred of Texas said he was praying for the congregants in Colleyville.", "\u201cNo one should have to fear something like this may happen in their place of worship,\u201d he said on Twitter."]
